meanings.definition: Lacking brightness or interest; drearily dull.
meanings.sent1: The room looked drabbest with its faded curtains and worn-out furniture.
meanings.sent2: The old, drabbest painting on the wall hardly caught anyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The party was so drabbest that even the balloons seemed bored.
meanings.sent4: Her drabbest outfit made her blend into the background like a chameleon.
meanings.sent5: The drabbest sky I've ever seen was a dull gray that seemed to go on forever.

meanings.definition: Of a dull or dingy color.
meanings.sent1: The drabbest walls in the house desperately needed a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: The cat's fur was the drabbest shade of brown I had ever seen.
meanings.sent3: The drabbest sweater she owned was a strange mix of gray and green.
meanings.sent4: The drabbest carpet in the room looked like it had seen better days.
meanings.sent5: The drabbest flower in the garden was a sad, wilted daisy.
